inputs.description: print only line #LINE_NUM (1-based) e.g. -line 1   (shows top line)
inputs.name: LINE

inputs.description: use sep_str as separation string  Examples:  column_cat -help column_cat file_a file_b column_cat file_a file_b file_c > output_file column_cat -line 17 file_a file_b file_c > output_file column_cat -sep : file_a file_b > output_file column_cat -sep '\t' file_a file_b > output_file column_cat -sep ' : ' file_a file_b > output_file cat file_a | column_cat -line 27 stdin  R Reynolds    Jan, 2002 (distributed Aug, 2012)
inputs.name: SEP
